data.name: Tyrant Double Red
data.description: The big brother of our Tyranny Red Ale, this heavily dry-hopped ale is a delicious creation. Tyrant is full of malt rich flavors backed up with deep pine, herb and grapefruit peel aromas, all around a hop heads dream. This is a big, bad beer that drinks a little too easy for the 8.5% abv. Pair with fish n’ chips and attitude.

style.name: Imperial Red Ale
style.description: Imperial Red Ales are deep amber to dark copper/reddish brown. A small amount of chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Fruity-ester aroma is medium. Hop aroma is intense, arising from any variety of hops. Medium to high caramel malt character is present. Hop flavor is intense, and balanced with other beer characters. They may use any variety of hops. Hop bitterness is intense. Alcohol content is very high and of notable character. Complex alcohol flavors may be evident. Fruity-ester flavors are medium. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Body is full.

breweries.name: Wicked Weed Brewing Company
breweries.description: Wicked Weed Brewing is based in Asheville, North Carolina. Opened in December 2012, the original brewpub (91 Biltmore) consistently hosts 25+ beers on tap including hop-forward, West Coast-style ales, open fermented Belgians, and barrel-aged beers. With the opening of the second location, The Funkatorium, in October 2013, Wicked Weed is striving to become one of the leading producers of barrel-aged sour and wild beers in the Southeastern United States. Wicked Weed Brewing was awarded a gold medal for both 100% Brettanomyces Serenity in 2013 and Mompara Honey Ale in 2014 at the Great American Beer Festival. Wicked Weed most recently opened 50-barrel production brewery that will allow for wider distribution in the Southeast.

breweries.name: Scottsdale Beer Company
breweries.description: Scottsdale Beer Company embraces the tradition of the early American brewing industry, prioritizing freshness and craftsmanship, and thriving to be wholly local. Through plate and pint, we honor time-tested techniques and traditions balanced with creativity, invention, and the occasional oddity. Inspired by the work of the masters from past generations, we’re offering up the concoctions of this era's expert craftsmen. We gladly offer you an open invitation to visit your community's brewery, meet the people that make your beer, and eat and drink in contentment.

breweries.name: Columbus Brewing Company
breweries.description: Columbus Brewing Company is located in the capital city's historic Brewery District. The Columbus Brewing Company was originally founded in 1830. In 1988, the name was once again chosen to resurrect the proud brewing heritage of its namesake. It's our goal to produce unique world class beers. So, we use only the finest ingredients, many locally harvested, to bring you the best in hand-crafted brews. Look for our award winning beers at your local grocery store and be sure to try our other seasonal selections on draft at fine restaurants and pubs throughout Ohio.

breweries.name: Jackalope Brewing Company
breweries.description: Jackalope Brewing Company is owned by Bailey Spaulding and Robyn Virball, two young ingénues with an affection for beer. They met in September 2002 in the tiny Scottish village of St. Andrews, Scotland. Bailey was a Harvard student doing a semester abroad and Robyn was beginning undergrad at St. Andrews. They bonded over being put into the worst dorm for overseas orientation and teaching Danish people how to play beer pong. Though after three months Bailey went back to Cambridge, you can't break the bonds that are made when teaching Europeans drinking games and a true friendship was born. During the next eight years, they both graduated, Bailey went off to Vanderbilt Law School, and Robyn entered the working world, but both thought they were meant for much bigger and more alcoholic things.

data.name: Uproar
data.description: The summer offering of our esteemed Ignition Series, Uproar Imperial Red is a complex, ruby-hued ale. Punctuated with notes of citrus and herbs, Uproar has a velvet texture with pleasing hints of roasty chocolate.

breweries.name: Pyramid Breweries
breweries.description: Based in the Pacific Northwest, Pyramid Breweries began as Hart Brewing in 1984 and launched the flagship brand of Pyramid Ales.  In 1996, the company was reborn as Pyramid Breweries and currently offers craft beers produced under the Pyramid family of ales and lagers.  With breweries in Seattle, WA, Portland, OR, and Berkeley, CA, Pyramid also owns Alehouses at all three locations and an additional Alehouse in Walnut Creek, CA.

data.name: Velvet Hammer
data.description: A tribute to our favorite Brewmaster, Greg Matthews, the Velvet Hammer appears as a dark, ruby reddish-brown ale beneath a sheath of protective off-white foam. It is malt-forward with elements of caramel and the sweetness of light brown sugar, balanced nicely by a combination of floral hops and a noticeable alcohol bite. It's a sturdy brew with a smooth character which belies both an inner strength and a slightly full body, along with a moderate bitterness to round out the taste.
data.foodPairings: This beer pairs nicely with any and all spicy foods. The high hop character of this beer helps cut the spice in the food dish.

breweries.name: Mission Brewery
breweries.description:
Originally located less than a mile from the very hill where Friar Junipero Serra and his scurvy-ridden crew drove their stake into the ground, Mission Brewery was born in those heady first days of the 20th century. And then prohibition shut it down. Re-established in 2007, we are honored to say that four months and four beers in, Mission was awarded two national medals at the Great American Beer Festival. Fast forward to 2010 our plunder of precious beer medals has gown considerably. Three Gold, three Silver and two Bronze medals now fill our bounty. A dream come true for long-time die-hard home brewers. From modest beginnings to a state of the art custom made brewery in the historic Wonderbread building just east of San Diego’s baseball stadium Petco Park. Our brewery should be brewing beer with in the month. Soon therafter our tasting bar will be open to the public. There’s nothing more enjoyable than a pint while watching the beer you’re drinking being made a few feet from where you’re sitting.
No catchy gimmicks. No national campaigns. Just great handcrafted beer made in San Diego!

breweries.name: Frey's Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Frey's Brewing Company is a small, Farmhouse Brewery in Frederick County, Maryland. Frederick County is home to several wineries and craft breweries. A small farmhouse brewery such as ours fits in the area nicely.

We received our Maryland Beer Manufacturer's Class 5 license on February 1st, 2013. We are allowed to sell beer for off-premise consumption directly to customers that have taken a tour of the brewery - but the amount is limited to 288 ounces. We are currently not allowed to do tastings at our facility, nor allow on-premise consumption of alcohol (unless it is part of a scheduled event). As of July 1st, 2013, we can refill growlers - so bring in your clean growler and we'll fill it up!

breweries.name: Eastern Shore Brewing Co
breweries.description:
Eastern Shore Brewing opened it's doors September of 2008 by owners Adrian and Lori Moritz.  Both had an entrepanerial passion, but never thought of a microbrewery as their business.  "The decision was made for us.  Make a business out of something you love to do and you will never work another day in your life" the couple states.  A lot of hard work and a love for good beer motivates the business. 
We decided to open Eastern Shore Brewing after talking with friends from St. Michael's Winery, and were told that the town was in need of a microbrewery.  After some discussion (less than you may think), we agreed and were on our way.  With some trials along the way in year one, year two proved to be the pinicle of change.  An increase in brewery size promoted an increase of staff.  Randall Marquis came on board as brewmaster in March of 2009 and has made his presence known.  An undergratudate of Franklin Marshall College, and a brewing certificate holder from UC Davis, Randy is a large portion of the success of Eastern Shore Brewing.  Three beers took home medals in the Maryland Govenor's cup competition (Bronze for Lighthause Golden Ale, Silver for the Duck Duck Goose Porter and a Silver for the St.ichael's Amber ALe) on October 9th.  And although happy with the medals, Eastern Shore Brewing's goals are to continue to grow the busines and improve their products.  Distribution ranges from Cambridge to Kent Island on the Eastern Shore of Maryland, and recently moved into Ellicott City, Maryland.  A new fermenter will be arriving shortly after the new year, which will increase capacity even further.
There is more to come....

data.name: Winter YuleSmith
data.description: Welcome to the holidays! Winter YuleSmith arrives each year as the weather turns cool and our cravings for winter warmers begin. This Imperial Red Ale has an intense hop aroma with well-balanced caramel malt sweetness. The intense American hoppiness builds on the substantial malt backbone to deliver a full-flavored beer with a ton of complexity.
data.foodPairings: Winter YuleSmith is the ultimate beer for holiday dinners. Succulent roasts and hearty stews are excellent companions to its robust malt and alcohol characteristics. The caramel flavors and bitter finish make this beer a great choice with flavorful charcuterie boards and rich, creamy cheeses.

breweries.name: AleSmith Brewing Company
breweries.description: Forged in 1995, AleSmith is an artisan microbrewery that specializes in handcrafted ales in a variety of styles. Deeply rooted in the amateur and craft brewing communities, AleSmith ales have continued to garner national and international awards and acclaim, as well as a loyal and rabid following among beer enthusiasts.

data.name: Wolf Rock
data.description: Eight nautical miles off Land’s End lies Wolf Rock, one of Cornwall’s most infamous offshore reefs. Named after the haunting cry that could be heard echoing across the ocean when gales howled through its craggy fissures, the sound warned sailors of its impending peril.

data.name: Wrenclaw Red
data.description: A rather non-traditional collaboration, this beer is the product of musical inspiration. Our good friend Dan Walkner came to us with a test pressing of his brand new album and said, “listen to it, then make a beer” (Being a proper gentleman, he also said please, and thank you). So obviously we saw this as an exciting opportunity and ran with it. The album is fantastic, tough but at times delicate and soothing; gritty but harmonious. The beer was designed to be much of the same; a strong malt bill gives a bold red color and curious nuttiness to set the stage for an assertive hop profile bursting with pine and orange zest. This remains one of our favorite projects and continues to receive requests for recreation.

breweries.name: One Barrel Brewing
breweries.description: Madison's smallest brewery opened on Friday, July 6 2012. One Barrel Brewing Company is at the intersection of Atwood and Winnebago streets, a.k.a. Schenk's Corners, it's like a coffee shop, only with beer instead of coffee". With a staple of No. 2 Strong Ale, other usual suspects include Penguin Pale Ale (a Belgian pale ale), and The Commuter (a Kölsch-style ale), but the small brew system will allows up to 10 beers on tap at a time, constant rotation of new brews.

data.name: Wynwood Fox
data.description: Wynwood Fox is based on the mythical creature that roams our concrete forest. Seen only in the midst of the night, we brewed this deep red hue ale in it’s spirit. A nice balance of malt, light fruitiness, and full on hops round out this ale. Here’s to you little buddy!
data.foodPairings: Pairs excellent with sausages and grilled meats.

breweries.name: Wynwood Brewing Company
breweries.description: Wynwood Brewing Company is Miami’s first craft production brewery in the heart of Wynwood Art District, featuring a tap room. We are family owned and operated with the simple objective of bringing fresh, delicious, and creative beers to thirsty South Floridians and tourists alike. We operate a 15-barrel brewhouse and distribute our blond ale, IPA, Porter, barrel aged Strong Ales and seasonal offerings.

data.name: XS Imperial Red
data.description:
Imperial Red is the newest addition to Rogues award winning Imperial Family of XS products. The Imperial Red recipe originates from Rogues Eugene City Brewery and is being produced in Newport for distribution (note, initially during 2007 in kegs only to JLS accounts. A 750-ml ceramic swing-top bottle and 13.2 gallon kegs will be available in 2008.) Imperial Red has already garnered international acclaim and awards, including a Bronze Medal at the 2006 Great American Beer Festiva and recently it was named Grand Champion at the US Beer Tasting Championships! 

Deep copper chestnut color with toffee, brown sugar, nuts, and spice amomas. A rich supple entry leads to an off-dry medium body of tangy raisins and citrus marmalade, bittersweet chocolate, and mild spice flavors. It finishes with a long nutty, fruity fade. 

Imperial Red is brewed with Crystal, Chocolate, Munich and two-row Pale Malts; Palisade and Aroma Crystal hops, Pacman Yeast, and Free Range Coastal Waters.

breweries.name: Rogue Ales
breweries.description: Rogue Ales was founded in 1988 by Jack Joyce, Rob Strasser and Bob Woodell, three corporate types who wanted to go into the food/beverage industry. Rogue's first brewpub was located in Ashland, Oregon and was a 10bbl brewsystem. Rogue opened a second brewpub, 15bbl brewsystem, in May 1989 located in Newport, Oregon. Rogue closed its Ashland operation in 1997, after the great flood destroyed the place. In 1991, the 15bbl system, named Howard after John Maier's former boss, from the Newport brewpub was transferred across the bay to the current brewery and upgraded to a 30bbl system. In 1998 Rogue bought a 50bbl brewsystem, named Kobe. Kobe is the only brewsystem in use. Tours: We offer brewery tours every day at 3 pm (followed by a distillery tour at 4pm). Go up to the bar inside the brewery (Brewers on the Bay) and check in with the bartender and the tour will commence. Please call ahead if you have a large group and or to verify the tour time...Brewer's on the Bay phone is 541-867-3664. The view from Brewers on the Bay includes the marina (outside), and the bottling line and brew kettles (inside).

locations.name: Rogue Ales at the Portland Airport

data.description: Yola is a contradiction. Sweet yet assertive. This imperial amber is a bottled-conditioned artisan ale able to be enjoyed at 45 degrees with or without sediment. Unfiltered, bottled-conditioned, Real Ale.

breweries.description:
A limited production artisanal nano brewery located in Carson, Iowa. Opened December 21, 2011.

To produce full flavored, real beer with the highest quality from local ingredients and sell that beer to our friends and family.

CIB is a small batch, production only nano brewery with an emphasis on flavor, evironmental responsibility, local artwork, ingredients, and distribution.

breweries.name: Urban Legend Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Urban Legend Brewing Company makes unique beers the traditional way. Beer is our passion. We believe that our beer can make the world and our local community a better place! We use only the highest quality ingredients and make small batches to ensure that we supply our community with the purest, freshest, highest quality beer possible. Our goal is to support local businesses and American manufacturing wherever possible. We are committed to recycling, reusing, and reducing our carbon footprint while at the same time making unique beers for discerning beer lovers and craft beer newbies. We will think local and will contribute to the local economy. 
The beer we produce will be available in our brewery and at local bars, restaurants and liquor stores. Fresh beer always tastes the best! Pints in the taproom, growlers to go, and small scale, local distribution is our way of ensuring our product is in its prime when it gets to your glass. We have a number of staple beers on draught plus we will be providing a rotating line of seasonal and specialty brews. We love to rediscover ancient beer recipes as well as spend a lot of time developing a unique styles.
As we say.....Great Beer, Born Here.
